episodes.title: Hot-mic at Epstein deposition: Les Wexner’s lawyer caught saying 'I'll kill you' | Jesse Weber Live
episodes.description:
Trial attorney Mark Geragos joins NewsNation as newly released video shows Les Wexner telling House investigators he was misled by Jeffrey Epstein, calling him a “world‑class con man.” Wexner denied any knowledge of Epstein’s crimes, but a hot‑mic moment with his lawyer urging him to stop talking raised eyebrows. Afterward, Wexner’s spokesperson reaffirmed he was never aware of Epstein’s illegal activity.

"Jesse Weber Live" brings a fresh, fast-paced, and often unexpected take on the day’s headlines, diving into the biggest stories through the lens of legal expertise. Weeknights at 11p/10C.



NewsNation is your source for fact-based, unbiased news for all Americans.

episodes.title: Prince Andrew arrested: Royal biographer Andrew Lownie on the biggest royal crisis in history
episodes.description:
Royal biographer and historian Andrew Lownie — author of "Entitled: The Rise and Fall of the House of Windsor" — joins @PaulaFroelich to break down the arrest of former Prince Andrew on his 66th birthday and what it means for the British monarchy. 

Lownie reveals what King Charles knew and when, whether Andrew is a flight risk (or worse), what happens to Sarah Ferguson and why this could ultimately bring down the Crown itself. Plus: The implications for Prince Harry, Princess Eugenie and Beatrice and whether William is ready to step up as king. 

Andrew Lownie’s book "The Rise and Fall of the House of Windsor" is available now.

🔔 Subscribe for more exclusive interviews and breaking royal news.

#PrinceAndrew #RoyalFamily #HouseofWindsor

episodes.title: Epstein ranch investigation, new clues in Nancy Guthrie case | Jesse Weber Live Full Show 2/17
episodes.description:
Tonight on "Jesse Weber Live": Senior national correspondent Brian Entin reports the latest clues investigators are piecing together in the search for Nancy Guthrie. Crime scene investigator Sheryl McCollum also weighs in. Then, forensic analyst Joseph Scott Morgan joins the show to discuss the investigation at a New Mexico ranch once used by sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Plus, the search continues for missing backcountry skiers after a group of 16 people encountered an avalanche in California. 

"Jesse Weber Live" brings a fresh, fast-paced, and often unexpected take on the day's headlines, diving into the biggest stories through the lens of legal expertise. Weeknights at 11p/10C.

episodes.title: Who are the Epstein co-conspirators? | CUOMO
episodes.description:
The Justice Department released nearly 30,000 pages of new Epstein files, most of them heavily redacted. A viral letter attributed to Epstein was later deemed fake by the DOJ. One key revelation showed the FBI sought to contact 10 alleged co-conspirators after Epstein’s 2019 arrest, but their names remain redacted. Former Trump attorney Jim Trusty and NewsNation correspondent-at-large Geraldo Rivera join "CUOMO" to discuss.

Chris Cuomo hosts "CUOMO," a no-nonsense show featuring the day's most important news from all perspectives. "CUOMO" airs weeknights at 8p/7C on NewsNation. #CUOMO

episodes.description:
Former NXIVM member and author Sarah Edmondson joins "Banfield" to discuss parallels between NXIVM leader Keith Raniere and Sean “Diddy” Combs. Both men are accused of using sex, threats and manipulation to build their empires, and both were or are facing sex trafficking and racketeering charges in the Southern District of New York. Notably, they’ve shared the same defense attorney, Marc Agnifilo. Raniere was sentenced to 120 years in prison.

episodes.description: In a NewsNation 'Banfield' exclusive, Courtney Burgess says he was given 11 flash drives containing at least eight Sean “Diddy” Combs sex tapes involving eight celebrities. Burgess testified before the Combs grand jury in the Southern District of New York on Thursday.  He tells 'Banfield' that among the eight celebrities who were Combs’ “victims,” “two to three” were minors.

episodes.title: Missing in paradise: Woman vanishes from Bahamian yoga retreat | Banfield
episodes.description:
The Bahamas’ director general of tourism has offered her sympathies to the family of Taylor Casey, a 41-year-old Chicago woman who local authorities say has not been seen for six days. Casey disappeared from a yoga retreat on Paradise Island — five miles from Nassau — on June 19. An active police investigation is currently underway. NewsNation's senior national correspondent Brian Entin visits the retreat to get some answers.

episodes.title: Twin Flames Universe former member: 'Extremely fortunate to get out' | Banfield
episodes.description:
A former member of "Twin Flames Universe" says she's "very grateful" she escaped what she believes was actually a cult. "Unfortunately, anyone can fall prey to coercion," Keely Griffin tells victims advocate Elizabeth Smart during a "Banfield" special report. "It was one giant web of lies that kept getting worse and worse." Cecilia Peck, Netflix's "Escaping Twin Flames" director, investigated the online community and also joins the conversation. 
#twinflamesuniverse #netflix #elizabethsmart

episodes.title: TikTok dancer rebuts ‘cult’ claims of Netflix documentary | Banfield
episodes.description:
7M dancer Miranda Derrick, who’s at the heart of “Dancing for the Devil,” says she’s been receiving death threats because of the Netflix documentary about the NXIVM cult. It tells the story of how Derrick and others were sucked into NXIVM, what they thought was a church combined with a talent agency for TikTok dancers. Now, Derrick is rebutting the claims made about NXIVM founder Robert Shinn. Ashleigh Banfield talks about the controversy with Sarah Edmondson, host of the “A Little Bit Culty” podcast and who calls herself a NXIVM cult survivor.

episodes.description:
